job.title: Data Analyst
job.industry: Marketing and Advertising,Computer Software,Hospital & Health Care
job.description: Angi is the home for everything home. From repairs and renovations to products and financing, Angi is transforming every touch point in home services. With over 25 years of experience and a network of nearly 250,000 pros, we have helped more than 150 million people with their home needs. Our products and technology help our customers love where they live while helping small businesses grow and thrive. We believe the home is the most important place on earth and we are at the beginning of our ambitious journey to redefine how people care for their homes - join us!About the role:The Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining, improving, and creating tools and processes to be used by the Angi's Client Success and Sales Originations teams. This role will sit in our Indianapolis, IN headquarters.What You'll DoPrepare organizational sales reports, charts, and graphs in support of the sales departmentWork directly with sales and leadership to set reporting requirements for their needsCollect and analyze data from multiple databases including Microsoft excel, SQL, and Salesforce.com and additional sources to evaluate current and historical trends dailyCreate various reports for internal departmentsProactive monitoring data within CRMMaintain and execute daily and bi-weekly responsibilitiesLead by example, maintaining a positive, cooperative attitude especially in times of change/challengePerform related duties as required or assignedWho You ArePossess a Bachelor's degree or better in Finance, Business Analytics, Economics or a related field, is preferredHave Previous Business Analyst Experience (preferred)Have strong experience with MS Office, particularly ExcelHave working knowledge of Salesforce and SQL is a plusHave the ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with co-workers, management team, other Departments, vendors, and outside agencies, including being sensitive to professional ethicsHave the ability to work in a metric driven environment and remain goal orientedPosses skills in complex problem solving, judgment, critical thinking and decision makingHighly organized with an emphasis on accuracy and timeliness, and have attention to detail to accurately follow proceduresAbility to maintain self-motivation and work alone with minimum supervision, and with others in a team environment, occasionally under time pressure and on several tasks at the same timeHave the ability to sit the entire work day viewing a computer monitorHave the ability to work occasionally more than 40 hours a week, evenings, and weekends to meet deadlinesCompensation & BenefitsThis position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus & equity package.Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needsFlexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need itPet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K)The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the worldPDN-9407c2d1-c02a-4775-a859-b91bcb06dbe2
